metadata.title: CVE-2019-20373 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
LTSP LDM through 2.18.06 allows fat-client root access because theLDM_USERNAME variable may have an empty value if the user's shell lackssupport for Bourne shell syntax. This is related to a run-x-session script.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldm - 2:2.18.06-1+deb10u1build0.20.04.1
ldm-server - 2:2.18.06-1+deb10u1build0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ldm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.18.06-1+deb10u1build0.20.04.1').
